column4: apt-get install apache2  php5  libapache2-mod-php5   mysql-server-5.0   mysql-client-5.0   php5-mysql
on 3 boxes it worked afair, on 1 it dont work
Have you done a manual GET request to the problem server, to see what mime-type it reports for the PHP page?
the instll was not customized nor anything
if it fails to work by default then its a bug?
how to reinstall apache+php totally cleanly from start?
yes, a file foo.php is downloaded instead interpreted
so the site has its own apache configuration directives, I'd check those, and also, I'd be reading the /var/log/apache logs
Have you tried putting a test "info.php" in the web-server's default home, rather than in the specific site, to see if it is a server or site problem?
yes, that file is also downloaded
And have you checked that the two php links are in /etc/apache2/mods-enabled?
